Name: Kawamura
Why it is good: World's finest Kobe beef restaurant - Chef Kawamura personally selects each cut of A5 grade beef
Dietary notes: Limited vegetarian options - primarily beef focused
Tips: Reservations essential weeks in advance - budget ¥20000-30000+ per person

Name: Steak Misono
Why it is good: Birthplace of teppanyaki - authentic Kobe beef with historic atmosphere and show cooking
Dietary notes: Good seafood and vegetarian options available
Tips: Budget ¥8000-15000 per person - lunch sets offer better value than dinner

Name: Ganko Ramen
Why it is good: Authentic tonkotsu ramen with 12+ hour slow-cooked broth - perfect comfort food
Dietary notes: Some vegetarian broth options and chicken-based ramen available
Tips: Quick service perfect for conference breaks - order at vending machine with pictures

Name: Kobe Port Tower
Why it is good: Iconic red tower with 360-degree harbor views - perfect conference break spot
Dietary notes: Cafe and restaurant options available at base
Tips: Open 9:00-21:00 - ¥700 admission - less crowded in morning

Name: Sannomiya District
Address: Sannomiya Station area, Chuo-ku, Kobe-shi, Hyogo
Why it is good: Main commercial hub with dining and shopping - highest concentration of restaurants and bars
Dietary notes: Every type of cuisine available from street food to fine dining
Tips: Get Port Liner day pass - peak dinner 19:00-21:00 so go earlier or later

Name: Kitano Foreign District
Why it is good: Historic Western-style houses from 1800s with stunning harbor views
Tips: Perfect afternoon conference break - comfortable shoes for hillside walking
